data.text: Is Gravelkings Super Slick Plus Tubeless Tires Any Good?

Getting a set of 38 mm Gravelkings Super Slick Plus tubeless tires installed on the stock wheels for my new Domane etap. Do they run pretty fast on light gravel? This is my first time going tubeless...as a 100kg rider do I need to be concerned about lower pressures going off road like I had to be with tubes?

I‚Äôd always recommend checking out the Silca pressure calculator to make sure your tyres are at the right pressure. Me + my bike comes in at about 90kg and on a 50mm 650 tyre I have them at 30psi, on a 30mm 700 tyre it‚Äôs 60psi.
data.author: Jon MacKinnon

data.text:
is right. Use the Silca calculator. https://silca.cc/pages/sppc-form
SILCA Professional Tire Pressure Calculator
silca.cc
data.author: Cory Anderson

data.text: I'm also 100kg and I run 40 or less psi in my 38's
data.author: Andrew Huff

data.text: We have several riders in Atlanta using the GK Slicks and they kick my ass every time, so I guess they run fast üòâ I fluctuate just under or above Clydesdale category depending on what I eat that day and have flatted once using tubeless, crossing a stream at Unbound, which I knew better. My Stans took care the problem pretty quickly.
data.author: Wayne Whitesides

data.text: Seeing you tube videos about unbound made me really want to get into gravel riding! Hope to try it one day!
data.author: Trey Freeman

data.text:
Shameless plug... come see us at our mixed-gravel event in October. It's an easy flight from DC and Delta flies bikes for free. Great testing ground for Unbound. https://spinthedistrict.com/about-union-city-fondo/
About Union City Fondo - Spin The District
spinthedistrict.com
data.author: Wayne Whitesides

data.text: My favorite tire for anything but mud and slick conditions. Great for trail and mixed hard pack and paved road
data.author: Nicholas Snider

data.text: I'm 98kg right now and rode around 40 psi in my 700x40mm tires last night.
data.author: Cory Anderson

data.text: The beauty of tubeless is that you won't get pinch flats. You just need enough pressure to make sure you don't bottom out the rim if you are on rough terrain.
data.author: Cory Anderson

data.text: I'm excited to try it out! The bike shop is setting up my tires. Do I need a special air pump to keep them inflated or will my current pump work?
data.author: Trey Freeman

data.text: current pump is fine. Make sure the valves arent right at the bottom of the tire when filling.
data.author: Steve Fuller

data.text: you‚Äôll be fine. Tubeless is a game changer. I‚Äôd never run tubes in any bike ever again.
data.author: Cory Anderson

data.text: Setting up a set later today! Got them for basic gravel and "upstate" (PA) roads (almost gravel) - Should roll pretty fast and if like the Gravel King SK's (I also have) hopefully just as bulletproof ü§û
data.author: Donald Myers

data.text: I run these on my 650b midnight special.. great tires, fast rolling.. not ideal when wet or on extremely loose terrain. I do about 60% pavement on that bike in generally dry conditions
data.author: Jerry Riggle

data.text: Most likely since they're pretty wide but I wouldn't be going too hard in loose gravel on those. You might find yourself eating shit
data.author: Christopher Snow

data.text: I'm based in DC. The gravel around us is pretty moderate. All the local riders said it should be ok, but I'll definitely consider a different tire for the harder stuff. What tire would you recommend?
data.author: Trey Freeman

data.text: Trey FreemanSchwalbe G one allarounds @40c are my guys right now, I don't use tubeless though. I commute and stuff , those tires are very grippy on tarmac in dry wet and snow, grippy on gravel and dirt but I wouldn't recommend them for mud
data.author: Christopher Snow

data.text: Love these tyres and will be putting mine back on now we are headed for summer
data.author: Fraser Kynaston

data.text: The ‚ÄúPlus‚Äù versions don‚Äôt like lower pressure (<40psi) and are definitely not as fast as the non-plus versions. But if you are not racing, this won‚Äôt matter.
data.author: Matt Simm√∏ns

data.text: GK slicks - even in 38 are pretty light and fast. I run them on my titanium merlin gravel/all road bike and post avg mph rides as fast as my S-Works Tarmac on 28 wide road tires more frequently than I probably should! Can't comment on longevity or durability with a 100kg rider as I'm only about 56kg, but I've never had issues...
data.author: Steve Heintzelman

data.text: they ride fast if you pedal fast
data.author: Ismael Cuevas

data.text: ftp is 310...that fast enough?
data.author: Trey Freeman

data.text: Yep, that‚Äôll do üòÅ
data.author: Dan Montgomery

data.text: Faster you pedal the faster they go!
data.author: Josh Weiser

data.text: I pedal pretty fast üòâ
data.author: Trey Freeman
